image.altText: Four women sitting together in front of Aboriginal paintings. White woman to left, three Aboriginal woman to right.

props.synopsis: Emily Kam Kngwarray has been recognised as "one of the world's leading artists" after becoming the first Australian whose work is the subject of a solo exhibition at the Tate Modern Gallery in London.

title.children: Renowned NT artist becomes first Australian with solo Tate Modern show

image.altText: An Aboriginal man wearing a red flannelette shirt holds a yellow electric guitar and stands next to a drum kit and microphones.

props.synopsis: For Liam Tunkin, making music is about continuing his late father's legacy and sharing a dark part of Australia's history.

title.children: Bush band's song tells story of Maralinga atomic bomb tests

image.altText: A white man in a dark blue suit jacket, button up shirt, black pants, walking along a public footpath.

props.synopsis: After almost two weeks of evidence, a court hears closing statements in the trial of former Alice Springs school principal Gavin Morris, who is accused of physically assaulting five children.

title.children: Court hears closing remarks in trial of former Alice Springs principal

image.altText: A man holding his hat and smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Legendary Yolŋu actor David Gulpilil held an ambition throughout his career to share a part of himself and his culture that the world had never seen before. A new documentary does exactly that.

title.children: New documentary brings David Gulpilil's dying wish to life

image.altText: A Virgin and Qantas plane flying in opposite directions with two velocity and frequent flyer credit cards in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Millions of Australians are signed up to airline loyalty schemes, but a new global ranking finds travellers are getting poorer value than from overseas carriers.

title.children: Hidden risks of frequent flyer points and one traveller's $5,000 lesson

image.altText: Woman with dark hair and fringe wears jeans and purple sweater sitting with feet crossed in a bay window. Cushions beside her

props.synopsis: Kate Reid's Lune croissants have been called the world's best. But how did a young woman struggling with a near-fatal eating disorder end up perfecting pastry?

title.children: Kate Reid was in 'anorexic prison' when she created a world-famous croissant

image.altText: Several people sitting at a table, looking on.

props.synopsis: Moscow's drone incursion into Polish airspace this week may have just laid bare how fruitless Europe's summer of talkfests has been.

title.children: Why the answers to Europe's Russia issues could lie in their own backyards

image.altText: A sign with a photo of Premier Jacinta Allan with the word banned in a window.

props.synopsis: Rural residents and local councils are deeply unhappy with new taxes, renewable energy, bad roads and mining companies, accusing the state government of "city centric" policymaking.

title.children: 'White-hot anger' in the bush as Victorians take on Allan government

image.altText: G8 graphic

props.synopsis: Despite G8 knowing about problems, an ABC investigation can reveal how the childcare giant downplayed concerns and maintained it had conducted checks.

title.children: A $26m unorthodox childcare deal with devastating fallout

image.altText: Soldiers from PNG out in the field.

props.synopsis: Australia is set to "totally integrate" its military with Papua New Guinea's forces, PNG's defence minister has said, as the two countries prepare to sign a landmark treaty.

title.children: 'Totally integrated': Australia to join military forces with PNG

image.altText: woman in big hole

props.synopsis: From the search for Daniel Morcombe to a flaming roadside torso, Queensland's top forensics cop deals with some of the state's worst crimes — when she's not identifying fallen Australians on WWI battlefields.

title.children: Crime scene 'bone lady' helps victims of horror speak from the grave

image.altText: Mark Speakman in Kiama

props.synopsis: For a party that had just suffered a heavy defeat, the mood at the Liberals' post-election event was surprisingly upbeat on Saturday night.

title.children: Pressure mounts on Speakman after Liberals' Kiama loss

image.altText: A crowd of Union Jack and Welsh flags.

props.synopsis: The march was organised by far-right activist Tommy Robinson while a counter protest by anti-racism campaigners also took place as the country continues to be dogged by the issue of immigration.

title.children: More than 100,000 anti-immigration protesters in UK amid scuffles with police

image.altText: A man in a dark jacket and pants holding a phone to his ear walks past a brick building that says "Punkah Pantry".

props.synopsis: As a police operation to find alleged gunman Dezi Freeman continues with no end in sight, Porepunkah residents share their anxiety about being left in limbo.

title.children: As an intense Victorian manhunt continues, locals are feeling the pain

image.altText: A man throws a box of paper money and incense wrappers on a roaring bonfire.

props.synopsis: More than a few spirits haunt the remote Indian Ocean territory, according to islanders deeply connected to its fraught and sometimes tragic history.

title.children: Appeasing the hungry ghosts of Christmas Island's painful past

image.altText: A young beaded man in a pattern green and white island shirt, flanked by lawyers and officials, speaks to media.

props.synopsis: Pacific Island nations are weighing up how to use a historic international court ruling in their fight to bring about stronger emissions reductions and climate justice.

title.children: The Pacific won a stunning climate victory. What's next?

image.altText: Tom Gleeson on the set of Hard Quiz gesturing behind him with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: It's time to show me your exceptional trivia knowledge. Ha!

title.children: Think you're Hard Quiz contestant material? Prove it

image.altText: A group of labor reps take a selfie with premier Minss

props.synopsis: The NSW Premier said Kiama now has the ear of the government after it claimed victory in the by-election triggered by the resignation of convicted rapist Gareth Ward.

title.children: Premier backs 'fierce advocate' for Kiama after by-election victory

image.altText: A large plume of smoke with a flame behind it.

props.synopsis: Israel in recent days has intensified strikes across Gaza City, destroying multiple high-rise buildings and accusing Hamas of putting surveillance equipment in them.

title.children: Air strikes kill at least 32 in Gaza City as Israel ramps up its offensive

image.altText: a map of a proposed rezoning of sections of parramatta road ythat could see more housing alongthe corridor

props.synopsis: The NSW government strikes a deal with Inner West Council to move forward with a plan to rezone sections of busy Parramatta Road that could see up the construction of up to 8,000 new homes.

title.children: One of Sydney's busiest and 'tired' roads could get up to 8,000 new homes

image.altText: A beekeeper with a bee smoker.

props.synopsis: Beekeepers on Kangaroo Island are demanding that biosecurity measures be boosted to prevent a deadly parasite from wiping out the island's world-famous bee sanctuary.

title.children: World-famous bee sanctuary under threat from destructive parasite

image.altText: A Canadian player holds the ball against two Wallaroos defenders.

props.synopsis: The Wallaroos miss the chance to reach the Rugby World Cup semifinals, losing heavily 46-5 to Canada in Bristol.

title.children: Wallaroos' World Cup hopes dashed by dominant Canada

image.altText: A rally in Sydney

props.synopsis: Rallies against racism and in support of Indigenous sovereignty coincide with mixed anti-government protests in major cities around the country.

title.children: Capital cities witness day of protest across political spectrum

image.altText: A photo of two men in suits smiling

props.synopsis: Convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein intentionally sought out some of the world's most powerful people. Here's how they have responded to his disgraced reputation.

title.children: The key names from Jeffrey Epstein's rich and powerful circle

image.altText: Ange Postecoglou gestures from the sidelines during a Nottingham Forest match.

props.synopsis: Ange Postecoglou promises a quick response after a brutal re-introduction to the Premier League, with Nottingham Forest defeated by Arsenal 3-0.

title.children: Postecoglou faces 'Tottenham in disguise' jibe in Forest debut

image.altText: A graphic of a mobile phone held in a hand, grimacing emojis, and #cringe in big, black print in the foreground.

props.synopsis: A psychologist says the growing online phenomenon of "cringe" is making young people avoid doing things they fear are embarrassing, sometimes to their detriment.

title.children: Young people want to avoid being seen as 'cringe' but there's a cost

image.altText: Carlton players celebrate during a match against Gold Coast.

props.synopsis: Inaugural Carlton player Gab Pound says the club has reached a turning point after not making the finals since the 2020 COVID-interrupted season.

title.children: Inaugural Blue hopes for finals berth after hot start

image.altText: Ty Gallop flexes his arms as he celebrates an AFL goal for the Lions against the Suns.

props.synopsis: Bouncing back from a resounding loss to Geelong, the Brisbane Lions comfortably dispense of the Gold Coast Suns to advance to the preliminary finals.

title.children: Lions credit Cats for setting up Suns' semifinal demolition

image.altText: Nicho Hynes hugs a Sharks NRL teammate during elimination final against Roosters.

props.synopsis: The Sharks are looking to correct the mistakes of the past, as they advance to the semifinals with a 20-10 victory over the Roosters.

title.children: Sharks reflect on overcoming 'fair bit of pain' as finals journey continues

image.altText: Sebbi at the beach

props.synopsis: It might be hard to leave the one of the most idyllic places in Australia, but it is not a case of paradise lost for this retiring pest-hunting pooch.

title.children: Paradise's four-legged guardian retires from pest-hunting role

image.altText: A woman cleans graffiti off white walls on a large white building

props.synopsis: The curfew was lifted after Nepal swore in its first female prime minister, following deadly protests.

title.children: Nepal authorities lift curfews after gen Z protests

image.altText: Torrie Lewis runs next to Sha'Carri Richardson

props.synopsis: Torrie Lewis broke the national record to claim a spot in the women's 100m semifinal, as Lauren Ryan recorded Australia's best finish in a 10,000m final since 2003 on day one of the World Athletics Championships.

title.children: Lewis breaks record to make 100m semis, Browning misses out by 0.008s

image.altText: A close-up shot of a hand resting on an elderly woman's hands.

props.synopsis: Advocates warn the number of people with the condition could exceed 1 million without government intervention.

title.children: Australians dying from dementia more than any other cause

image.altText: A black and yellow frog and a woolly alpaca in two separate images next to each other.

props.synopsis: Disease-resistant frogs, cane-toad-munching quolls and other gene-edited native animals could be roaming the nation within the next decade. What could go wrong?

title.children: Frogs with alpaca genes could soon be hopping around Australia
